fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2416].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Page automatically scrolls to the bottom when grabbing a field to re-arrange the order.
This happens on every movement so if the list is longer than the height of the screen, it is very hard to move things up the list.

h3. Environment
* Google Chrome. Tested happening on Versions 43.0.2357.132, 45.0.2454.101 (64-bit)
* Browser Window height < ~600px (or long Fields list)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the Window of your browser to a reduced height of about ~500px
# As anAgent go to a Service Desk Project Request Types admin section
# Click on Edit Fields of a Request Type
# Without being at the bottom of the page, grab a field
# Move the field at least 1 pixel in any direction

*Expected Results:*
Field is selected and page doesn't scroll. Field can be moved around without the page scrolling unless the mouse is at the furthest of the page

*Actual Results:*
The page scrolls to the bottom of the page on every movement.

h3.Workaround
* Use a different web browser
* increase the window size or sreen resolution if possible
fields.summary: Request Type Fields section automatically scrolls to the bottom when arranging fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2415].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Since Service Desk view and JIRA project view were merged, the link to Reports only shows Service Desk reports, while JIRA default reports are missing.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a Service Desk project
# Click *Reports*

h3. Expected Results
Service Desk and JIRA default reports should be shown

h3. Actual Results
 !Screen Shot 2015-10-12 at 5.40.13 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Add the link below to *Project Shortcuts*:
https://your_instance.atlassian.net/projects/your_project_key/?selectedItem=com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:report-page
fields.summary: Consider making possible to view JIRA Core reports in a Service Desk project type
Option to remove or modify auto populated text
revert how adding a comment works

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2412].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

By having Service Desk Emails setting enabled we can't have incoming mail log and Debug mode for incoming mail.
The workaround is to create a dummy incoming mail handler with same details a Service Desk mail setting to be able to debug the incoming mail.

h3. Solution 

By enabling Service Desk mail setting the mail handler should be shown at incoming mail handler page(refer to JSD-1831) so it helps to have debug mode for the Service Desk too. 

h3. Workarounds 

# Type ‘g’ + ‘g’ + start typing ‘logging and profiling’
## Navigate to the ‘Default Loggers’ section
## Click ‘Configure logging level for another package’
## Type {{com.atlassian.mail.incoming}} and set the logging level to debug
## Click ‘Add'
## Then replicate the issue again
## Mark the log with "replication starts here"
## Replicate the problem ( Send a test mail to the inbox and *make sure the email is processed* ) 
## Mark the log again with "replication ends here"
## Generate a new [Support Zip|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Getting+Help#GettingHelp-CreatingaSupportZip] and attach it here
# In order to enable debug mode for service desk mail and have the basic logs, a dummy mail handler with same details should be created in JIRA incoming mail.
fields.summary: Debug Mode for Service Desk Mail

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2411].
  {panel}

Hi Support 
For example I had created 5 users in one customer group/project name. After different users created different problem cases under same project name but it seems that those cases could not be viewed each other. I want them all can see their problem cases each other. How to do it?

Regards,
Kenneth
fields.summary: How to let customer to see all problem cases within their group

fields.description:
{panel}
{panel:title=Update as of 22/Apr/2021}
Hello everyone,

Thank you for sharing your feedback. We evaluated this ticket and understand that this is something we need to improve on. However, we will not be able to prioritise this at the moment as there are other items in the short term roadmap which are higher priority. We will definitely get back to you once we pick this up in our short term roadmap.

Regards,
 Sushant Koshy, Product Manager, Jira Service Management
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2410].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When viewing issues in the Customer Portal view, the column with the comments use always the same amount of space (width) regardless of the width of the browser window.

In resolutions wider than 1680 this is less than 50% of the screen and makes it hard to read when pasting logs or other formats that are not just simple comments.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the width wider if browser window is wider.
 
h3. No workaround 
Using browser zoom it will make text occupy more screen space but because the size is bigger it will still make logs inside comments hard to read.
fields.summary: As a SD Customer I'd like the Portal view to expand to the width of the window
REST API Goal not as ID but time in miliseconds
As a user, I want to be able to enter my email address to "Forgot password" form
Improve documentation related to pre-populated customer greeting
Make the ticket number searchable in the customer overview
Add ticket reference to custom portal overview

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2399].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
At the moment, SLAs without any goals will not be displayed in Issue Navigator/View Issue screen. This makes the SLA field rather useless if there isn't any goals defined as we can't really do anything about it. Sometimes agents just want to keep track of the SLA without defining any Goals

h3. Suggestion
For SLAs without any goals, make it appear in Issue Nav/View Issue screen but counting upwards. At least agents can keep track of them and also use them for reporting purposes
fields.summary: SLA without any Goals

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2398].
  {panel}

h5. Summary
JQL queries actually do not consider JIRA Service Desk calendars.

h5. Suggestion
It would be really useful to filter issues depending on JIRA Service Desk calendar:

Example:
* identify what issues are generetad inside time interval configured in the calendar
* identify what issues are generetad outside time interval configured in the calendar

Ideally it would work without being forced to specify the time interval in the JQL, but letting the system know which is the time interval based on project name and day of the week the issue is created.
fields.summary: JQL queries that consider Jira Service Desk calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2396].
  {panel}

If I click on "My requests" link on the Service Desk Portal, I don't see all my open requests.

https://groupemedia.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/user/requests?status=open

I'm not the only one with this problem. 

I'm an administrator of our Service Desk and I would like to know what is the request behind the "My open requests" choice.


Thanks
fields.summary: Portal My request doesn't show up all open request

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2395].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Customer notifications doesn't follow the User Profile. It remains in English no matter what language the profile or JIRA is in 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA for Service desk, set up Outgoing Mail and create a new SD project
# Create a normal user
# Log in as this user and change the profile to another language (eg. French)
# As this user, create a request via Customer Portal

h3. Expected Results
# This user receives an email in French (or whichever language they configured)

h3. Actual Results
# The user will receive an email in English

h3. Notes
# In JIRA 6, the email will be based on the language of the user profile

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: JIRA for Service Desk (v3.0) Email Notification doesn't follow User Profile Language
Users can't log tickets
Ticket Export Option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2389].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Automation does not work when the action in 'Then' box have to perform transition issue

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Navigate to Service Desk Automation
# Add *New Rule* -> Custom role
# Add *Issue Created* trigger in 'When' box
# Add *Issue matches* in 'IF' box
# Add any *Transition Issue* in the 'THEN' box

h3. Expected Result
If the newly issue created matches with the 'IF' box condition, the transition should be triggered.

h3. Actual Result
The transition does not trigger.

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: In Automation, the transition issue action does not work in the "Then" box.
Extend automation plugin to call custom actions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2384].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Customer Portal Timezone follows JIRA Cloud System Timezone instead of the timezone set by the customer through their Profile. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set Customer's Profile Timezone to GMT +3
# Customer created a request through Customer Portal 
# Timestamp of the request is following the JIRA Cloud System Timezone GMT +0

h3. Expected Results
* Customer Portal timezone should follow the timezone set by the customer through their Profile.

h3. Actual Results
* Customer Portal timezone follows JIRA Cloud System Timezone regardless of the timezone set by the customer through their profile.

SD Version: 3.0.0-OD-04-002-D20150924T014602
fields.summary: Customer Portal Timezone follows JIRA Cloud System Timezone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2381].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Customer would like to hide or anonymize Assignee information from being viewed by Service Desk Customers 
They do not wish to have the Assignee's Name, Picture, or Email Address visible to Customers

h3. Suggested Solution
An option for Agent privacy from Service Desk Customers
 
h3. Workaround 
No complete workaround to fully hide this information:
- Use a Generic Photo for the Agent's Profile Picture
- Rename Agent to a generic Name
fields.summary: Hide or Anonymize Assignee Information for Customers
List of Service Desks using Menu "Service Desk/All Service Desks" is not alphabetically sorted
Not work support@smartline.atlassian.net

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2374].
  {panel}

When enabling public signup, user accounts will get created in the first User Directory where JIRA has the appropriate permissions to create user account in, and that directory allows the password to be updated.

As an administrator, I want to be able to differentiate which user directories are being used form my normal JIRA users, and JIRA Service Desk customers.

Having a configuration option available to define which User Directory should be used for Public Signups (and customer invitations) from JIRA Service Desk would be a great addition to have.

Since Public Signup can get enabled per Service Desk, having this option also available per Service Desk, opposed to Service Desk as a whole, would be even greater.

This would allow for a much more streamlined process when running multiple Service Desk with Public Signup enabled.
fields.summary: As an administrator I want to be able to select which user directory is used for public signups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for {*}JIRA Service Desk Cloud{*}. Using {*}JIRA Service Desk Server{*}? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2373].
{panel}
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*Update 7th December 2021*

Hi everyone,

We have added an enhancement to show agents in the user view that the comment is from a person who does not have access to the issue. Please see this [documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/allow-external-emails-to-be-added-as-comments-on-issues/] for more information on how to turn the feature on.

Cheers,
Jason and the Jira Service Management Team
{panel}
h3.  

Summary

When a customer of a JIRA Service Desk sends an E-mail from Service Desk to another person (who is not an agent, reporter or request participant) of the issue, if that additional party replies to the issue and includes the JIRA Service Desk E-mail, the E-mail is treated as a new issue, even though:
 - Subject Line contains the Issue Key,
 - Email Headers are still intact.

For Example:
 # Customer 1 raises a Service Desk request.
 # Agent 1 responds to the Service Desk Request.
 # Customer 1 receives a response and CC's the response to another Customer (Customer 2).
 # Customer 2 responds to the service desk request, CCing in the same people.

Creating new E-mails under this scenario causes additional overhead for the Service Desk Administrator, and may be confusing to the customer interacting with the Agent, due to the fragmented nature of the E-mail interactions

This was introduced as a result of the changes in: JSD-1876 which fixed an issue when a user who was not a Service Desk customer responded to a Service Desk Email.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a new Service Desk
 # Create an Issue and Send a Comment to a customer as an Agent
 # As a customer forward the issue to a colleague to get help responding to the Agents queries
 # Respond to the agent, and customer as the external party.
 # The response will not be linked to the existing issue unless you are already a request participant of the issue.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA Service Desk should be able to detect the E-mail trail relates to a specific issue, and give the customer an option to enable Automatic request participants based on Email interactions.
h3. Actual Results

JIRA Service Desk fails to recognise that the Emails in the aforementioned scenario relate to a pre-exiting issue, even thought the Email contains the correct headers, subject line, and the other users in To/CC fields are the customer and the Service Desk Email address.
h3. Notes

The current functionality for inbound E-mail appears to be:
 # Check who the sender of the Email is
 # Add sender as a new customer if they are not (depending on SD configuration)
 # Decide what to do with E-mail content based on the sender's authorisation.

h3. Workaround

Please use either *Service Desk Automation* _or_ the *JIRA Automation Plugin* to do this.

*Using JIRA Service Desk*
 # Go To your *Settings* under the affected JIRA Service Desk
 # Select *Automation
 # Create a new Rule and select "Custom Rule" with the following:
 ## {*}WHEN{*}: Issue Created
 ## {*}IF{*}: Issue Matches and Create an Advanced JQL filter
 ## {*}THEN{*}: _Add a Comment_ that indicates that the user is not authorised to comment on the request
 ## *THEN* _Issue Transition_ that Resolves the issue.

*Using the Automation Add-on*
 # Create a new Rule
 # Set the Issue Event to be Issue Created
 # Set the JQL Expression to something S
 # Add Actions as to how you would like to handle this circumstance.

*Note on JQL matching.*
The Affected issues are expected to contain:
 - Your E-mail Prefix in the Subject line of the Email
 - An Issue Key in the Subject line of the Email
 - Either a "Re:" or "Fwd:" in the Subject line of the Email.
 - The content should contain "{_}This message is automatically generated by JIRA Service Desk.{_}"

Therefore we can create a JQL query to match on these issues:
{code:java}
text ~ '"This message is automatically generated by JIRA Service Desk."~0' 
AND 
(summary ~ "Re \\[CDX\\] \\[SD" OR summary ~"Fwd \\[CDX\\] \\[SD") 
{code}
You could add different options to this JQL Query as you see the need to do so, such as project filters. See: [Performing Text Searches|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Performing+Text+Searches] for more hints on this.
fields.summary: Identify the correct Issue for incoming E-mails from unknown users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2370].
  {panel}

We use Jira Service Desk Cloud to provide support for our software product which is used by multiple external companies. Currently when users report an issue they have to type in their phone number every time they report an issue since it is not associated with their user record. We would like to propose to: 

* Allow Custom fields to be added to the Jira and JSD user account (Phone number, Company, etc) 
* Allow the above Custom fields to be updated from JSD Sign Up form

The first time user goes to our JSD Customer Portal he would be presented with a login form which would include Phone Number and a drop down of supported external companies. After user provides this information once at sign up he would not have to provide it again during subsequent interactions with the system. We will be able to contact the user and manage users more effectively.
fields.summary: Feature Request: Allow Custom fields to be added to Jira and JSD User Accounts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2369].
  {panel}

We use Jira Service Desk Cloud to provide support for our software product which is used by multiple external companies. Currently when users report an issue they have to type in their phone number every time they report an issue since it is not associated with their user record. We would like to propose to: 

* Allow Custom fields to be added to the Jira and JSD user account (Phone number, Company, etc) 
* Allow the above Custom fields to be updated from JSD Sign Up form

The first time user goes to our JSD Customer Portal he would be presented with a login form which would include Phone Number and a drop down of supported external companies. After user provides this information once at sign up he would not have to provide it again during subsequent interactions with the system. We will be able to contact the user and manage users more effectively.
fields.summary: Feature Request: Allow Custom fields to be added to Jira and JSD User Accounts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2359].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Service Desk login page (i.e _https://<instance>.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/2/user/login?_)
# Click on _Forgotten your password_
# Enter any random entry in Username field
!Screen Shot 2015-09-25 at 11.46.36 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Current Result
Service Desk will display the reset was successful.
!Screen Shot 2015-09-25 at 11.46.48 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Result
Service Desk should display the an error message for any event that the password could not be reset. i.e user doesn't exist, the entry is incorrect
fields.summary: Password Reset doesn't Provide Error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2358].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Multiple JIRA Service Desk Add-ons are not enabled after recent maintenance.  
This prevents a customer from both receiving Service Desk Notifications and Editing any Automations in their Service Desk Project.  

h3. Environment
* JIRA v7.0.0-OD-06-002 with JIRA Service Desk v3.0.0-OD-03

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# View Automation for Service Desk 
or 
# Search for {{Service Desk}} in Manage Add-ons (*g+g* > Manage Add-ons)
 !ServiceDeskAddons.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
Service Desk Automation functions normally. 
All Service Desk Add-ons are enabled

h3. Actual Results
No errors in JIRA Logs.

When viewing the Automation Page:
!AutomationPage.png|thumbnail!

When editing an Automation:
!EditAutomation.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
Open a support request to restart JIRA to cleanly re-enable all add-ons.
fields.summary: Multiple Service Desk Add-ons Not Started and Prevents Automation from Working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2355].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a service desk admin , would like to have multiple email configured for creating issue per service desk project . Each email creating a different request type/priority .

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide multiple email setting per project for creating issue . Each email create different request type/priority issue .
fields.summary: As a service desk admin , require multiple email configured for creating issue per service desk project.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2354].
  {panel}

I have configured an Issue Security Scheme which does not allow particular JIRA users from viewing issues inside the Service Desk project.

But the customer portal shows a link, only for JIRA to then tell me I don't have permission to do this operation.

h2. Steps to reproduce

* Create an issue security scheme in a project, with security levels restricting a particular user (reporter) from viewing the issue. Set this is as the default issue security level.
* Create an issue in the customer portal as the user who does not have permission
* Observe the Reference link in request details page

h2. Actual outcome

* Link is valid to click
* Click the link and see that JIRA gives a permission error

!link.png|thumbnail!

!invalid.png|thumbnail!

h2. Expected outcome

* The Reference link in the customer portal will not be a link (text only), as the user can not actually see the issue
fields.summary: Customer Portal show a link to an issue I do not have permission to view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2353].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

As a customer , JIRA Service Desk Customer Portal displayed Date format as per configured in JIRA Look & Feel configuration . For example , configuration set to displayed dd.mm.yy format . However , during issue creation in Customer Portal still displayed default date but followed the date configured format in view issue screen.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Make sure to [Disable Relatives Dates in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Disable+Relative+Dates+in+JIRA]
# Then , edit *Day/Month/Year Format* configuration at *Look & Feel*
!Screen Shot 2015-09-30 at 3.42.56 PM.png|width=500!
# Display *Due Date* field for *Customer Portal*
# Create an issue from *Customer Portal* and select a *Due Date* . It will display the default date format.
!Screen Shot 2015-09-30 at 3.44.54 PM.png|width=500!
# View issue will present the configured *Day/Month/Year Format*
!Screen Shot 2015-09-30 at 3.45.02 PM.png|width=500!

h3. Expected result
The customer portal create issue page should followed the date format configured . Just like in the view issue screen.

h3. Suggested Solution
Customer Portal date followed as per configured in JIRA Look & Feel configuration.
fields.summary: As a customer , JIRA Service Desk Customer Portal displayed Date format as per configured in JIRA
Adding more options to Customer Portal under "You can"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition
Set default "Comment Viewable by" in project level . For user with certain role in project , create a comment , it will by default set certain group/role to view the comment.

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.summary: As an admin , allow to set default "Comment Viewable by" in project level

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2343].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
# Open an issue in Agent view
# Click on comment
(!) With the buttons "Share with customer" and "Comment Internally" when clicking "Comment Internally"  the template is not removed by default.
!1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
When clicking on comment Service Desk should display the comment section with the tabs which would automatically remove the template. (Similarly to the behavior when you click "Respond to customer")
!2.png|thumbnail!

Alternativly, when clicking "Comment Internally" the template should be removed automatically

h3. Workaround 
Remove the template manually before clicking "Comment Internally"
fields.summary: Comment Internally Action should Automatically Remove Template for Respond to Customer
Option "Settings > Request security" On Service Desk Is Not Available
Allow Internal Comments to be Restricted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2339].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Using the Old Navigation on Service Desk, after delete a issue from a queue using 'gg'+delete the screen doesn't return to the queue. Instead that is returning to Search for issue screen.

h3. Environment
Service Desk 3.0.0-OD-03-001-D20150914T041818

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the Service Desk using the Old Navigation
# Go to a queue
# Open an issue
# Type 'gg' and than type delete
# Click on delete

h3. Expected Results
After delete an issue the screen should return to the actual queue.

h3. Actual Results
It returns to the Search for Issue screen.
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
Use the New Navigation for Service Desk.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk doesn't return to queue after delete issue
Have option to add TO field in emails as Request Participants
No Option as "Settings > Request security" On Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2336].
  {panel}

h3. Service Desk Customers can be added to JIRA groups (for organization purposes) but this has to be done via the User Management page. As an admin, it would be great if we can add these customers to groups straight from the Service desk page

h3. Suggestion
# Have an *Groups* button in the Service Desk page to allow admins to add customers to groups without having to navigate to the User Management page
# Allow admins to specify a group when they invite customers. When the customer creates an account, they will automatically be added to this group
fields.summary: Add customers into groups via Service Desk page
Add the ability for "flagging" issues like in JIRA Agile

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2334].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JSD-1491 describes an issue as Resolved wherein subsequent email replies to an email linked to Service Desk creation are creating duplicate SD issues.  It notes the fix version for OD as 2.4-OD-04.

We are running JIRA Service Desk v3.0.0-OD-02-001-D20150907T065544, and are still having this issue.  

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Set up SD instance using support@foo.com for customers to email, and SD issues to be auto-created
# Customer finds issue, emails support@foo.com with subject "Foo Is Broken", and CC's 3 other people, SD-1 issue is created with *Foo Is Broken* title
# One of the CC'd users replies to the email thread, including support@foo.com as a recipient, "Re:  Foo Is Broken" becomes subject of the email thread

h3. Expected results
* Replying person's email content from step 3 is added as a comment to the SD-1 issue, no duplicates issues are created

h3. Actual results
* Replying person's email from step 3 creates SD-2 with *Re:  Foo Is Broken* title.  SD-1 and SD-2 are not linked in any way.  Content from replied email in SD-2 is not present in SD-1 and vice versa.

h3. Notes
I'm not 100% certain, but it seems to be arising from "Re:" being added to the subject line of the email.  This is extremely tedious to deal with.
fields.summary: Service Desk still creating duplicate issues
As an administrator I want to set my customers to see all their requests by default

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2331].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Similar to JSD-2301, except that this is specifically for the Customer Portal.

In a default Customer Portal, there will be the following default fields
* What do you need?
* Why do you need this?

These fields are different from the *Comment* field in JSD-2301, hence the separate ticket. The behaviour is the same though. Any data entered into the fields will not be preserved if a user accidentally navigates away and click the *Back* button.

!portal.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Save entered data when clicking after clicking "Back" button in Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2328].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When we click on some of the forms in customer portal, the page focus is on the first text field which is automatically selected. If the field is at the bottom of the page user will need to scroll up to the top of it.

h3. Suggested Solution
Change the page focus to the top of the page.
 
h3. Workaround 
Set the text field as first field of the form.
fields.summary: Change the page focus when opening customer portal forms.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2327].
{panel}
Currently, it's only possible to edit portal names, default language, front page title, logo, help center banner, and color scheme.
h3. Suggestion

Ability to apply additional customizations to the Help Center / portal pages, such as:
 * Layout
 * Favicon
 * Search bar placeholder text ("Find help and services")
* Change the "Contact us about" text
fields.summary: Allow further customization of Customer portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2326].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
# Installing Service Desk will create several custom fields (ie. Customer Request Type, Request participants, etc. When the default language is English, these custom fields will be created in English (name and description). When the default language is another language, these fields will be created in the said language. For example, French would be *Participants à la requête* and *Type de requête client*.

However, after it is installed, the name and description will not be updated accordingly if the default language is changed. When originally installed in French, the fields will retain their French name and description even though the default language is changed to English

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change default language to French
# Install Service Desk
# Check the custom fields page to see the names/description created in French
# Change the default language to English

h3. Expected Results
# The name and description is automatically translated to English		

h3. Actual Results
# The name and description remains in French

h3.Workaround
Change these values directly from the database in the *customfield* table
fields.summary: Service Desk custom fields not able to be translated accordingly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2325].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a service desk admin , would like to have *request-channel-type* column to add in search issue list .

Reproduce Steps
1) Issues 
2) Search for issues
3) enter any search criteria
4) Select Columns
5) Search for request-channel-type or Service Desk Request Channel Type or just Channel

h3. Suggested Solution
Add request-channel-type or Service Desk Request Channel Type or just Channel at search issue list .
fields.summary: As a service desk admin , would like to have request-channel-type column to add in search issue list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2324].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

*Images are broken in email:*
This is a problem with the JIRA Service Desk. When an image is attached by an internal account or by a customer, the image that shows up in the automated email is broken.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Steps to Reproduce \[bug 1\]:
# Create a Service Desk ticket as an agent or as a customer. Here is the portal: 
# Make sure your Agent account is the assignee. Make sure your customer account is the customer on the ticket.
# Log in as an Agent  and navigate to the Service Desk.
# Open that ticket on behalf of a customer for editing and go to "More" and select "Attach Files".
# Make an external comment and attach an image to it.
# Log into the email account associated with the customer account. You should see the email come through with a broken image for the attached email. 

\[bug 2\] The problem also happens the vice-versa direction, and presumably this is the same underlying issue:
# Log in as a Customer  and navigate to your list of open tickets.
# Edit the same ticket and add an image to a comment.
# Log into the email account associated with your Agent account

\[bug 3\] A third related problem is when you comment and add the attachment on the same time, JIRA doesn't recognize that it exists when it sends the email, so the email contains an error message for the attachments, saying it doesn't exist, even though it is successfully added to the ticket. Another email is sent right after saying the attachment was added:
# Same steps as above, only add the attachment on commenting, by clicking the attachment icon

\[bug 4\] This can also be replicated with emoticons.

h3. Expected Results

The customer should receive an automated email with that external comment. 

h3. Actual Results
\[bug 1 and 2\] In first two cases, the images are broken:
!attachment_after_commenting.png|thumbnail!

\[bug 3\] The third problem shows this:
!attachments_when_commenting.png|thumbnail!

\[bug 4\] Here is the emoticons problem:
!emoticons.png|thumbnail!

h3. Note

It seems that an agent emailing him/herself does not cause this problem.

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Broken images in SD emails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2323].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
At the moment, a Service Desk mail notification will only consist of the current change (which caused the notification) and the previous few comments. 

In a request with many back and forth replies, the email will not show *all* the reply but only the latest few

h3. Suggestion
Make it configurable that the Mail Notification be sent with the entire request (description along with *all* comments.

h3. Use Case
Some organizations prefer to use Customer portal to track their request but there are many who also prefer to purely use email for this. With the current implementation, users will only get to see the latest few comments which will force the user to access the Customer Portal to read through the entire request if he/she needs to. With this Suggestion, everything will be sent in the email so that user no longer has to manually access the Customer Portal
fields.summary: Send full request via mail notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2320].
  {panel}

Scenario 1: You have an automation rule already set (e.g: When customer comment on the ticket, the tickets is re-opened) and the Service Desk Customers don’t how do this works.
Scenario 2: The customers don’t know exactly the functionality about Service Desk.
Scenario 3: You have to add daily notes for your Customers.

By the mentioned scenarios, it would be nice if you could add notes on the _My Requests_ page where the customers could check in order to have the right instructions based on Service Desk/Automation rules and notes about the company environment.
fields.summary: Ability to add notes on the My Requests Service Desk screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

JSD-2230 has been fixed, but the problem still exist in the JIRA pages that are the JSD agent view pages.

Known affected pages:
* JIRA issue view page
* JIRA Issue Navigator column view
fields.summary: Request type icons are not aligned correctly in the JIRA non-agent view pages
Service Desk - Customer Portal - Custom CSS

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2316].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Service Desk Project created for internal jira-users, would create request through _Create a New Service Desk Request_ link. Once request is created there's no way to get back to the Dashboard/Main application 


h3. Suggested Solution
Optional Link to the Main Dashboard that would be in the top bar after the request is created. This would be optional that can be turn ON, in some Service Desk Project

h3. Workaround 
Click on the back button on the browser to get back to the Dashboard/Main application
fields.summary: Ability to go back to the Main Dashboard when a request is created through the JIRA Dashboard
Images in emails received from customers are not in-line with text

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2312].
  {panel}

Hello Team 

Our Company wants to use the JIRA Service Desk for all our clients. So we are talking about 50-500 Clients/Organizations (with 100-10000 employees) each using the customer portal to raise their Support Tickets. We want to give them an efficient Ticket Management system/Portal.  So our intention is to let each Client (1-2 Admins) be able to review reports on all their tickets raised with us. We think its too much manual work for us to generate each type of report they require fortnightly/monthly for 500-1000 organizations. It seems like a lot of unnecessary  manual work.

We understand JSD Agents only have that permission. We are ready to purchase JSD Agent license for 1-2 people for each organization BUT we want to restrict their access from editing workflows , viewing our internal communication , work logs, etc. Basically we just want them to be able to see issues raised by their own organization and create reports based on them.

Do you think this is possible? My first alternative was to give them JIRA License but they can  still see our internal communication and worklogs which is bad :( We cant seem to attach our server related attachments to the support Ticket , hiding it from the client. I dont think we want to create duplicate tickets in a different project every time and work on those duplicated tickets rather than the original. 

Can you please suggest a solution or suitable alternative solutions ? 

Thank you for your time and support. 

Regards
Manjusha
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk - Clients should have a reporting feature

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2311].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
At the moment, every email which is received by the email account associated to the SD mail handler will be created as a request if possible. 

Some organizations have a phone number to be contacted by and when a call is missed, an email will be sent. This email will always be of the same Subject. If the email is sent to the SD mail, it will create a request which doesn't contain any information.

h3. Suggestion
Allow admins to configure a string in SD for email subjects to be ignored.

The Mail handler will compare this string to the subject of all mails and if it matches, the email will be ignored.
fields.summary: Ignore certain mails from processing based on email subject
As a JIRA Service Desk Agent/Administratory, I want to be able to query request types based on request type group

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2309].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

If a collaborator is the reporter on an issue and an internal comment is added to the issue, the reporter/collaborator will not receive the email notification.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue with an user that is also a collaborator or agent in the project.
# Add an internal comment with another user.

h3. Expected Results
The reporter should receive the notification as they are a collaborator/agent as well.

h3. Actual Results
* The reporter doesn't receive any notifications about internal comments, even if the user is also the assignee.
* No actions triggered by the reporter are sent (any comments or transition done by the user in the agent side sends notification for the reporter).
 
h3. Notes
If the reporter is changed, the old reporter will receive the notifications if set as watcher.

Considering the following scenario:
* Two users: user1, user2
* Both users are agents

This is the current behavior:
||Assignee||Reporter|| Commenter || Internal Comment||Notification||Expected?|| Why? ||
| any | user1 | user1 | (x) | (x) | (x) | According to the latest [Managing service desk notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Managing+service+desk+notifications] docs: the customer should always receive notification when _a comment is added to the request_.  | 
| user1 | user1 | user1 | (/) | (x) | (?) | They should receive the notification as per the same reason as above |
| user1 | user1 | user2 | (x) | (/) | (/) |  | 
| user1 | user1 | user2 | (/) | (x) | (x) | User is considered as "customer" only and therefore doesn't receive notification for internal comment, even though he is also the agent. |
| user1 | user2 | user2 | (/) | (/) | (/) | |
fields.summary: When a reporter is also a collaborator, he/she should get both customer notifications and internal comments' notifications.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2307].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Previously, in older version of Service Desk (prior to version 3.0), the email notification sent from JIRA Service Desk had a different template with more information regarding the issue status and also in html format
!previously.png|thumbnail!

Now, the email template is in plaintext format and only contains the message text sent from the Support Agent.
!current.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Some customers would like to have the old template available.
fields.summary: Email notification template changes in Service Desk 3.0
Automatically create customer while raising a request

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2300].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When entering data into a comment (eg. into comment section), a user can accidentally click on a link in the page causing the browser to re-direct the page to the new page. Clicking the *Back* button of the browser will return the user to the original issue. However, the behaviour is inconsistent
||Type of project||Chrome||Firefox||
||Normal Project|Clicking *Back* will reload all previously entered data|Clicking *Back* will load a new page. Any data entered previously will be lost|
||Service Desk Project|Clicking *Back* will load a new page. Any data entered previously will be lost|Clicking *Back* will load a new page. Any data entered previously will be lost|

Here are videos demonstrating the behaviour
* [^chrome.mp4]
* [^firefox.mp4]

Service Desk projects should be able to retrieve entered data as well

The behaviour also happens in Customer Portal. After re-directing to a new page (be it on purpose or accidentally), clicking _Back_ will *not* retrieve entered data. This will affects users who have entered a lot of data only to accidentally click on a link to be re-directed. All their data will be lost.

h3. Suggestion
# Make Firefox (and all other supported browsers) behave the same and able to retrieve entered data; AND
# Make Service Desk projects behave the same as well so that browsers can retrieve entered data

*OR*
# Have a pop up which warns users such that entered data will be lost
fields.summary: Save entered data when clicking after clicking "Back" button

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2298].
  {panel}

On JIRA Service Desk, sending an email to the mail handler and another customer using the TO field, results in the user being added as a participant.

On documentation: [Adding people to participate in requests|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Adding+people+to+participate+in+requests] it states:
{quote}
Note that email recipients in the TO and BCC fields will not be added as request participants. 
{quote}

*Problem:*
If JIRA Service Desk has as a Customer a user with the same email address than the one being used to fetch emails, it results in that user being added as Participant for every issue created, and thus receiving notifications for everything and processed again by JIRA.
JIRA Service Desk rejects incoming emails from itself to prevent loop.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# enable a Service Desk incoming mail
# create a user with that same email address (could be by sending an email from it's own address if create users is enabled)
# verify the user is a Customer of the Service Desk and can be added as Participant
# Send an email to the Service Desk
*Result:* User with the same email as the service desk gets added as Participant
*Expected:* an issue is created and the User with the same email address is not added as participant.

*Workaround:*
If the user with the same email address is not being used, disable it from the User Management to prevent him being added as a Participant, or remove it from the group of Customers of the Service Desk.
fields.summary: Users in the To field are added as participants when creating issue from email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2297].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there are a fix set of condition to start, pause and stop SLA.

h3. Suggested Solution
Condition to start, pause and stop SLA will accept custom field values as well.
fields.summary: Ability to have condition to start, pause and stop SLA based on custom field value

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2296].
{panel}
{panel:title=Product update 5 March 2021}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your votes and feedback on this issue. In the interests of being clear and transparent; although being a future roadmap consideration, this feature is not on our near term roadmap.

I will look to update it again in roughly 6 months time.

Cheers, 

Ben.
{panel}
h3. Summary

When a customer already exists in a Service Desk, if I re-invite them using an email address, nothing happens. It will be silently ignored.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the 'Customers' page in a Service Desk
 # Invite a customer, by clicking 'Invite', enter an email and click 'Send invites'
 ** The invite will be sent
 # Do the same process again _with the same email address_

h3. Expected Results

Either:
 * A new invite email is send (if this process was done twice, is most likely because the first one didn't work) or warn the user that a customer with that email already exists and no email will be sent.
 * No invite is sent, but I receive a message informing me this user is already a customer, but would I like to resend the invitation to this Service Desk

h3. Workaround

Depending on the type of invitation:
 - The initial invitation containing the link to set a password will only ever be sent once, when the user is initially created. After this time, the Forgot password link can be used.
 - Invitations to different Service Desks send a new invite email each time, and these are what can be re-sent.
fields.summary: As an admin I would like option to re-send an invitation email to a customer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2295].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Have a JSD project set up.
# Add a user to JIRA only

*Expected Results:*
This user should be added to JIRA only. Not having access to any JSD project.

*Actual Results:*
This user shows up in the customer's list and therefore can raise requests on the portal.
*Admins are not able to remove this user from the customer's list without deleting him/her from JIRA.*

*Behavior seen at:*
JIRA v7.0.0-OD-02-259
JIRA Service Desk v2.6.0-OD-11-003-D20150831T232628
fields.summary: Allow admins to remove jira users from customer's list.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2293].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
At the moment, when a user is in the *My Requests* page, there are 2 ways to go back to the Help Centre so that the users can create a new request. However, the links are not user friendly and pretty small. Although functional, it does not provide the best user experience
!1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggestion
Include a big *Create new request* button in this page so that users can easily create new request by clicking the link. Clicking on the link should either bring the user to a specific project if the user only has access to 1 project, or to the Help Centre if they have access to multiple projects
!new.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve Usability in Customer Portal My Request page
Customer portal should convey helpful message when a request fails to create.
Customer would like to get rid off the superfluous text in comment box

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2288].
  {panel}

When running a global team, calendars depend on local public holidays and working times. In these cases, 1 single function in a JQL can determine which calendar is to be used for the SLA.

If the same SLA is required to be used with a differentiation of 1 single JQL function to determine the calendar which needs to get used, in the current implementation a separate JQL has to get made for each corresponding calendar.

This means, that in a large environment with 10 SLAs and 5 separate calendars, 50 JQLs need to be built and maintained, which creates a huge administrative task.

As an administrator, I want to have a more intuitive way of being able to handle such large environments.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I want an easier way to setup and maintain SLAs in a large environment
Show Ticket Numbers on Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2284].
  {panel}

Unless I am mistaken, you can either enable globally the JSD notification schemes, bypassing the tweaks you can do in a notification scheme, or you have to turn it off and revert to the project-level notification scheme.

Unfortunately, this also removes the JSD email templates. We have several service desks at the office, and one of those we don't want it to be chatty towards the customers. What I would have liked to do was to disable the emails to the reporter, but leave everything else as-is.

After much pondering I ended up keeping JSD notification set to ON globally, and setting the project-level notifications scheme to NONE. This solves some of the problem, but service desk agents won't get emails either when we assign to them. 

It'd be nice if we had more control over this, such as turning OFF the service desk notification scheme at the project level, or use the project notification scheme to control when the emails are sent (but not their format).
fields.summary: Ability to toggle Service Desk notification scheme at the project level
Help Center - Header Customization
Multiples Service Desk (for multiple customers)  for one project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2281].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Users really dislike the fact that if they type a query in the landing page search box and then click away (say, to cut an paste something), the text they typed in is gone and they have to start from scratch again. It would be nice if this was not the case.

Screenshot before click away
!SearchContext_before.png|width=500!

Screenshot after click away
!SearchContext_after.png|width=500!

h3. Suggested Solution
Instead of auto clear you could auto select-all so that they have a choice of starting a new or adding to existing text.
fields.summary: As a user , search query at search landing page won't auto clear when click away
Queue containing issues from non Service Desk projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2270].
  {panel}

h3. Summary 
The Queue is hidden unexpectedly in the new navigation

h3. Step to reproduce:
# Click queues => queue menu is displayed.
# Click Customer.
# Click Project (for example: ONE) => queue menu is hidden.
# Click queues again.

h3. Expected Result
# Queue menu is displayed along list of requests.

h3. Actual Result
# Queue menu is hidden and no switch queue on top of list of requests.

h3. Version
JIRA v7.0.0
JSD v2.6.0-OD-12-001
fields.summary: Queue Menu is hidden unexpectedly in new navigation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2268].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In the Service Desk Queue(s) Display, somehow one ticket details is stuck on the below screen.
Screenshot is attached to this ticket.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue from a queue
# Resolve the issue
# Switch to a different queue

h3.Expected Result
Only the queue should show

h3.Actual Result
The issue remains rendered under the queue

h3.Note 
This also happens with issue actions other than resolve.
fields.summary: Issue Details Appear on Queue Screen - JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2267].
  {panel}


You provide self-help resources with a knowledge base for your customers.

We'd like to customize this function.

* The number of search results
** Now 3 results are displayed, we'd like to set the number of results
* Output per label as search results
** Now the result output results per page, we'd like to search labels on search box and output per label.
* Ability to rank KBs and show search result order by rank (it'd be great if JSD could automatically rank KBs)
** the current default result contains pages recently updated
fields.summary: Customize search results with a knowledge base
Include A Reporter Markup In Automation That Inserts A Reporter's Name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2263].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As of the Service Desk 2.6.0-OD-10 release, the Confirmation Email sent to customers does not include information about the issue they've created; ie does not include Summary or Description.

The Customer receives a generic message indicating that a Request has been created and the Service Desk Ticket ID. 
!ConfirmationEmail.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide Service Desk Admins the ability to modify the Email used by Service Desk or Include information (Summary and/or Description) about the initial request on the Confirmation Email sent out to Customers.
 
h3. Workaround 
none
fields.summary: Provide Summary and Description Information in Service Desk Confirmation Emails Sent to Customers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2262].
  {panel}

When mail can not be processed, due to the email not being from a known customer and not a public signup Service Desk, it would be useful if it is possible for an Admin or Agent to view those messages.

The Admin can currently see them in the Mail Audit Log, but not possible to action anything.

Would be useful if possible to:

* Choose to create a new customer from mail, and ticket
* Create a new customer and add as a Request Participant with comment to existing issue
* If attachments are corrupt or blocking an issue, select to skip attachments but create issue
fields.summary: Provide a way for Admin / Agent to view unprocessed mail queue and action items

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2261].
  {panel}

*Summary*
When Assigning or Transitioning an issue, from the Service Desk queue view, +using the Old Navigation style+, the screen is greyed out and a spinning wheel stays on the screen indefinitely. The task doesn't complete on the browser but it does in the background.
A refresh is necessary to continue using JIRA. If the task is performed from the "New Navigation Style" or the default JIRA view, the task completes normally

*Environment:*
* Jira Service Desk Cloud
* Old Service Desk Navigation Style enabled

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a new Service Desk project in JIRA Cloud
# Create a new issue in the project
# Change the navigation style by clicking on: "Switch back to old navigation" on the left column
# Click on "Assign to me" button
*Result:* A spinning wheel is shown indefinitely and an error is logged in the console
*Expected:* current user is assigned to issue and one can continue using JSD.

*Error:*
!browser_console_error.jpeg|thumbnail!

This error reads:
{noformat}
batch.js:12460 Uncaught TypeError: b is not a function
c @ batch.js:12460
h.onDialogFinished @ batch.js:12460
Dialog.extend._handleSubmitResponse @ batch.js:2614
Dialog.extend._handleInitialDoneResponse @ batch.js:2614
ajaxOptions.complete @ batch.js:2543
completeHandler @ batch.js:617
j @ batch.js:41
o.fireWith @ batch.js:43
c @ batch.js:167
b @ batch.js:179
{noformat}

*Workaround:*
* Use the New navigation style, by clicking on "Switch to new navigation"
* Refresh the page to resume work.
fields.summary: Infinite spinning wheel when assigning or transition issue from Old Navigation Style

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2257].
  {panel}

As a project admin, I'd like to be able to manage the "smarts" pre-populated texts on the comment section of an issue when an agent responds to a customer. 

When talking about manage, I mean:
- Set myself a default message.
- Set specific messages for each project.
- Enable/disable this feature as I like.

*Workaround to disable*

Enable the following dark feature from https://<instance-url>/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa: (in Cloud Atlassian Support will need to do this)

{noformat}
sd.email.conversational.notification.disabled
{noformat}


{panel:title=Service Desk Update - 12 October 2015}
Hi all,

We have added an option for agents to turn this functionality off as they wish in the 3.0.1, 3.1.0-OD-01 release. If you want to customise further, it's being tracked at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-631.

Bests,
The JIRA Service Desk team
{panel}

{panel:title=Service Desk Update - 4 September 2015}
Hi all,

Thank you for all your feedback. Before launching this new feature, our goal was to make service desk notification more conversational. We’ve made a decision to move forward with helping agents save time with a friendly greeting and sign off with the agent name to make it more personal. We acknowledge that this functionality isn't for every agent and your desire to customize these responses.
So far we've added additional translation strings for German, French and Japanese. 
You can also help us in translating for your language here if it is missing https://translations.atlassian.com/. 
The string are:

{noformat}
sd.comment.prepopulated.default.greeting=Hi {0},
sd.comment.prepopulated.default.anonymous.greeting=Hi,
{noformat}

The ability to edit these responses will require a bit more thought, the immediate action for us is to provide an option for agents to turn this functionality off as they wish in the upcoming release. If you want to customise further, it's being tracked at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-631.

Thanks for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach to feature requests.If you have further questions or comments, please feel free to contact me directly as well at jhuynh at atlassian dot com.

Bests,
The JIRA Service Desk team
{panel}
fields.summary: Allow admins to manage pre-populated texts on JSD.
Allow Issue Collector to embedded with Service Desk portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2255].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Unable to add/edit the "IF" condition in JIRA Service Desk automation rule.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Proceed to Automation
# Create a new rule or edit an existing rule
# Set When to Breached SLA 
# Attempt to select "Issue Matches" condition

h3. Expected Results
The automation rule can be edited without any problems/errors.

h3. Actual Results
Application shows "This condition could not be loaded." error message. This also occurs when editing existing IF conditions.
fields.summary: Automation - Unable to add/edit IF condition
Enable config setting to adjust auto pulling of incoming email intervals
